\begin{DoxyCode}{0}
\DoxyCodeLine{Use this command to configure area related parameters within an OSPFv2 router.}
\DoxyCodeLine{Below command options can be used}
\DoxyCodeLine{  area <area-\/id>}
\DoxyCodeLine{    Configures an area within a router by specifying an area-\/id in positive}
\DoxyCodeLine{    integer or dotted format.}
\DoxyCodeLine{  area <area-\/id> authentication [message-\/digest]}
\DoxyCodeLine{    Configures area level authentication mode. Authentocation mode can be clear}
\DoxyCodeLine{    text authentication or message-\/digest authentication.}
\DoxyCodeLine{  area <area-\/id> default-\/cost <cost-\/value>}
\DoxyCodeLine{    Configures NSSA or stub-\/area summary default cost.}
\DoxyCodeLine{  area <area-\/id>> filter-\/list prefix <prefix-\/list-\/name> in|out}
\DoxyCodeLine{    Configures prefix list for inter area prefix filtering. Inter area prefix}
\DoxyCodeLine{    propagation policies are configured using this command. Option 'in'}
\DoxyCodeLine{    is used for filetring incoming prefixes from the area and 'out' is used}
\DoxyCodeLine{    for filtering outgoing prefixes from the area.}
\DoxyCodeLine{  area <area-\/id> range <ip-\/prefix> [ cost <cost-\/value> | advertise cost <cost-\/value> | not-\/advertise | substitute <ip-\/prefix> ]}
\DoxyCodeLine{    Configures address ranges for inter area address propagation. Inter area}
\DoxyCodeLine{    prefix propagation policies can also be configured using this command.}
\DoxyCodeLine{    This command enables to configure prefix advertising rules directly without}
\DoxyCodeLine{    using andy prefix list. Cost of an advertized prefix can be modified using}
\DoxyCodeLine{    this command. Similarly a advertized prefix can be substituted by another prefix.}
\DoxyCodeLine{  area <area-\/id> stub [ no-\/summary ]}
\DoxyCodeLine{    Configures area to be stub area with stub options.}
\DoxyCodeLine{  area <area-\/id> shortcut enable|disable|default}
\DoxyCodeLine{    Configures area shortcut options.}
\DoxyCodeLine{  area <area-\/id> virtual-\/link <remote-\/router-\/id>}
\DoxyCodeLine{  area <area-\/id> virtual-\/link <remote-\/router-\/id> authentication [ null | message-\/digest ]}
\DoxyCodeLine{  area <area-\/id> virtual-\/link <remote-\/router-\/id> authentication-\/key <key> [ encrpted ]}
\DoxyCodeLine{  area <area-\/id> virtual-\/link <remote-\/router-\/id> message-\/digest-\/key <key-\/id> md5 <key> [ encrpted ]}
\DoxyCodeLine{  area <area-\/id> virtual-\/link <remote-\/router-\/id> dead-\/interval <time-\/value>}
\DoxyCodeLine{  area <area-\/id> virtual-\/link <remote-\/router-\/id> hello-\/interval <time-\/value>}
\DoxyCodeLine{  area <area-\/id> virtual-\/link <remote-\/router-\/id> retransmit-\/interval <time-\/value>}
\DoxyCodeLine{  area <area-\/id> virtual-\/link <remote-\/router-\/id> transmit-\/delay <time-\/value>}
\DoxyCodeLine{    Configures virtual link and its parameters in an area. Virtual link configurations}
\DoxyCodeLine{    are allowed on non-\/backbone area. Virtual links can have clear text password,}
\DoxyCodeLine{    message-\/digest based passwords or no password configured at all. When clear text}
\DoxyCodeLine{    and message digest passsword is configured, corresponding authentication-\/key or}
\DoxyCodeLine{    message-\/digest-\/key parameters must be configured. Timer parameters can also be}
\DoxyCodeLine{    configured for any Virtual links. Authentication key or password will be saved}
\DoxyCodeLine{    in encrypted form in configuration. User shall always provide actual password}
\DoxyCodeLine{    while configuring authentication keys. It is not recomended to use encrypted}
\DoxyCodeLine{    option of authentication key.}
\end{DoxyCode}

\hypertarget{md_cli_command-tree_industry_standard_cli_reference_guide_autotoc_md496}{}\doxysubsubsection{Description}\label{md_cli_command-tree_industry_standard_cli_reference_guide_autotoc_md496}

\begin{DoxyCode}{0}
\DoxyCodeLine{This command influences best-\/path selection algorithm by comparing}
\DoxyCodeLine{router-\/ids for identical eBGP routes}
\DoxyCodeLine{Ensure that when comparing routes where both are equal on most metrics,}
\DoxyCodeLine{including local-\/pref, AS\_PATH length, IGP cost, MED, that the tie is}
\DoxyCodeLine{broken based on router-\/ID.}
\DoxyCodeLine{If this option is enabled, then the already-\/selected check, where}
\DoxyCodeLine{already selected eBGP routes are preferred, is skipped.}
\DoxyCodeLine{If a route has an ORIGINATOR\_ID attribute because it has been reflected,}
\DoxyCodeLine{that ORIGINATOR\_ID will be used. Otherwise, the router-\/ID of the peer}
\DoxyCodeLine{the route was received from will be used.}
\DoxyCodeLine{The advantage of this is that the route-\/selection (at this point) will}
\DoxyCodeLine{be more deterministic. The disadvantage is that a few or even one}
\DoxyCodeLine{lowest-\/ID router may attract all traffic to otherwise-\/equal paths}
\DoxyCodeLine{because of this check. It may increase the possibility of MED or IGP}
\DoxyCodeLine{oscillation, unless other measures were taken to avoid these. The exact}
\DoxyCodeLine{behaviour will be sensitive to the iBGP and reflection topology.}
\end{DoxyCode}
\hypertarget{md_cli_command-tree_industry_standard_cli_reference_guide_autotoc_md497}{}\doxysubsubsection{Parent Commands (\+Modes)}\label{md_cli_command-tree_industry_standard_cli_reference_guide_autotoc_md497}

\hypertarget{md_cli_command-tree_industry_standard_cli_reference_guide_autotoc_md1305}{}\doxysubsubsection{Description}\label{md_cli_command-tree_industry_standard_cli_reference_guide_autotoc_md1305}

\begin{DoxyCode}{0}
\DoxyCodeLine{This command suppresses sending Capability Negotiation as OPEN message}
\DoxyCodeLine{optional parameter to the peer. This command only affects the peer is}
\DoxyCodeLine{configured other than IPv4 unicast configuration.}
\DoxyCodeLine{When remote peer does not have capability negotiation feature, remote}
\DoxyCodeLine{peer will not send any capabilities at all. In that case, bgp configures}
\DoxyCodeLine{the peer with configured capabilities.}
\DoxyCodeLine{You may prefer locally configured capabilities more than the negotiated}
\DoxyCodeLine{capabilities even though remote peer sends capabilities. If the peer is}
\DoxyCodeLine{configured by override-\/capability, BGP ignores received capabilities}
\DoxyCodeLine{then override negotiated capabilities with configured values.}
\DoxyCodeLine{Additionally the user should be reminded that this feature}

\begin{DoxyCode}{0}
\DoxyCodeLine{This command specifies an alternate AS for this BGP process when}
\DoxyCodeLine{interacting with the specified peer. With no modifiers, the specified}
\DoxyCodeLine{local-\/as is prepended to the received AS\_PATH when receiving routing}
\DoxyCodeLine{updates from the peer, and prepended to the outgoing AS\_PATH (after the}
\DoxyCodeLine{process local AS) when transmitting local routes to the peer.}
\DoxyCodeLine{If the no-\/prepend CLI option is specified, then the supplied local-\/as is}
\DoxyCodeLine{not prepended to the received AS\_PATH.}
\DoxyCodeLine{If the replace-\/as CLI option is specified, then only the supplied}
\DoxyCodeLine{local-\/as is prepended to the AS\_PATH when transmitting local-\/route}
\DoxyCodeLine{updates to this peer.}
\DoxyCodeLine{Note that replace-\/as can only be specified if no-\/prepend is.}
\DoxyCodeLine{This command is only allowed for eBGP peers.}
\end{DoxyCode}
\hypertarget{md_cli_command-tree_industry_standard_cli_reference_guide_autotoc_md3874}{}\doxysubsubsection{Parent Commands (\+Modes)}\label{md_cli_command-tree_industry_standard_cli_reference_guide_autotoc_md3874}

\hypertarget{md_cli_command-tree_industry_standard_cli_reference_guide_autotoc_md4645}{}\doxysubsubsection{Usage Guidelines}\label{md_cli_command-tree_industry_standard_cli_reference_guide_autotoc_md4645}

\begin{DoxyCode}{0}
\DoxyCodeLine{CIR: Committed information rate in bits per second. CIR is mandatory. The value can be optionally suffixed with kbps(1000), mbps(1000000), gbps (1000000000) or tbps (1000000000000)cir 300000000 cbs 300000000 pir 300000000 pbs 300000000.}
\DoxyCodeLine{CBS: Committed burst size in bytes. The value can be suffixed with KB(1000), MB(1000000), GB(1000000000) or TB(1000000000000). The default value is 20\% of the CIR in bytes. If configured by the user, it must be greater than or equal to CIR in bytes.}
\DoxyCodeLine{PIR: Peak information rate in bits per second. The value can be optionally suffixed with kbps(1000), mbps(1000000), gbps (1000000000) or tbps (1000000000000). If configured by the user, it must be greater than CIR}
\DoxyCodeLine{PBS: Peak burst size. The value can be suffixed with KB(1000), MB(1000000), GB(1000000000) or TB(1000000000000). The default value is 20\% of the PIR value in bytes. If configured by the user, it must be greater than PIR value in bytes and also CBS value}
\DoxyCodeLine{If only CIR is configured, then its 1 rate, 2 color policer.  Any traffic exceeding CIR value will be marked as red and will be dropped.}
\DoxyCodeLine{If both CIR and PIR is configured, then is 2 rate 3 color policer. Any traffic that exceeds CIR but less than PIR will be marked as yellow. Any traffic that is more than PIR will be marked as red and will be dropped}
\end{DoxyCode}

\DoxyCodeLine{CBS: Committed burst size in bytes. The value can be suffixed with KB(1000), MB(1000000), GB(1000000000) or TB(1000000000000). The default value is 20\% of the CIR in bytes. If configured by the user, it must be greater than or equal to CIR in bytes.}
\DoxyCodeLine{PIR: Peak information rate in bits per second. The value can be optionally suffixed with kbps(1000), mbps(1000000), gbps (1000000000) or tbps (1000000000000). If configured by the user, it must be greater than CIR}
\DoxyCodeLine{PBS: Peak burst size. The value can be suffixed with KB(1000), MB(1000000), GB(1000000000) or TB(1000000000000). The default value is 20\% of the PIR value in bytes. If configured by the user, it must be greater than PIR value in bytes and also CBS value}
\DoxyCodeLine{If only CIR is configured, then its 1 rate, 2 color policer.  Any traffic exceeding CIR value will be marked as red and will be dropped.}
\DoxyCodeLine{If both CIR and PIR is configured, then is 2 rate 3 color policer. Any traffic that exceeds CIR but less than PIR will be marked as yellow. Any traffic that is more than PIR will be marked as red and will be dropped}
\end{DoxyCode}

\begin{DoxyCode}{0}
\DoxyCodeLine{Use this command to display BGP neighbors, routes, peer-\/group etc. There}
\DoxyCodeLine{are various CLI options available to display various informations from}
\DoxyCodeLine{BGP. User can use "vrf" option to display information from a particular}
\DoxyCodeLine{VRF instance of BGP. User can also choose ipv4 or ipv6 to display}
\DoxyCodeLine{information from either of the address family.}
\DoxyCodeLine{-\/ show bgp ipv4 unicast summary}
\DoxyCodeLine{This command will display BGP global parameters as well as brief}
\DoxyCodeLine{information about BGP neighbors}
\DoxyCodeLine{-\/ show bgp ipv4 unicast}
\DoxyCodeLine{This command will show BGP local RIB routes. User can use filtering}
\DoxyCodeLine{options on CLI to zoom into a subset of routes that user is interested}
\DoxyCodeLine{in}
\DoxyCodeLine{-\/ show bgp ipv4 unicast neighbors}
\DoxyCodeLine{This will display one or all BGP neighbors information in detail}
\DoxyCodeLine{-\/ show bgp all peer-\/group}
\DoxyCodeLine{This will display one or all BGP peer-\/group information in detail}
\end{DoxyCode}

\begin{DoxyCode}{0}
\DoxyCodeLine{Use this command to display detailed information about a crash that has occured in the system. This command}

\DoxyCodeLine{core files are found which satisfy the match condition, information of all core files is displayed.}

\DoxyCodeLine{The following information about matching core files is displayed:}
\DoxyCodeLine{-\/  Time: The time of the crash, as reported by the kernel in UTC}
\DoxyCodeLine{-\/  Executable: The full path to the application executable that has crashed"}
\DoxyCodeLine{-\/  Core File: The file name of the application core dump of the executable that has crashed}
\DoxyCodeLine{-\/  PID: The identifier of the process that crashed}
\DoxyCodeLine{-\/  User ID: The user identifier of the process that crashed}
\DoxyCodeLine{-\/  Group ID: The group identifier of the process that crashed}
\DoxyCodeLine{-\/  Signal: The signal that caused the process to crash, when applicable}
\DoxyCodeLine{-\/  Command Line: The command line arguments of the process that crashed}
\DoxyCodeLine{-\/  Boot ID: The unique identifier of the local system that is generated and set on each system boot up event}
\DoxyCodeLine{-\/  Machine ID: The unique machine identifier of the local system that is set during installation}
\DoxyCodeLine{-\/  Core File Found: Indicates whether the captured core file exists on local disk or has been removed}
\DoxyCodeLine{-\/  Crash Message: A copy of the application stack trace information of the process crashed}
\end{DoxyCode}

\end{DoxyCode}

\DoxyCodeLine{modified using the port parameter. The outging interface may also be specifed using the interface}
\DoxyCodeLine{parameter. A valid system interface must be specified.}

\begin{DoxyCode}{0}
\DoxyCodeLine{This feature is used to enable read-\/only mode on BGP process restart or}
\DoxyCodeLine{when BGP process is cleared using clear ip bgp *. When applicable,}
\DoxyCodeLine{read-\/only mode would begin as soon as the first peer reaches Established}
\DoxyCodeLine{status and a timer for max-\/delay seconds is started.}
\DoxyCodeLine{During this mode BGP doesn't run any best-\/path or generate any updates}
\DoxyCodeLine{to its peers. This mode continues until:}
\DoxyCodeLine{All the configured peers, except the shutdown peers, have sent explicit}
\DoxyCodeLine{EOR (End-\/Of-\/RIB) or an implicit-\/EOR. The first keep-\/alive after BGP has}
\DoxyCodeLine{reached Established is considered an implicit-\/EOR. If the establish-\/wait}
\DoxyCodeLine{optional value is given, then BGP will wait for peers to reach}
\DoxyCodeLine{established from the beginning of the update-\/delay till the}
\DoxyCodeLine{establish-\/wait period is over, i.e. the minimum set of established peers}
\DoxyCodeLine{for which EOR is expected would be peers established during the}
\DoxyCodeLine{establish-\/wait window, not necessarily all the configured neighbors.}
\DoxyCodeLine{max-\/delay period is over.}
\DoxyCodeLine{On hitting any of the above two conditions, BGP resumes the decision}
\DoxyCodeLine{process and generates updates to its peers.}
\DoxyCodeLine{Default max-\/delay is 0, i.e. the feature is off by default.}
\end{DoxyCode}
\hypertarget{md_cli_command-tree_industry_standard_cli_reference_guide_autotoc_md8327}{}\doxysubsubsection{Examples}\label{md_cli_command-tree_industry_standard_cli_reference_guide_autotoc_md8327}

\DoxyCodeLine{sonic\# configure terminal}
\DoxyCodeLine{sonic(config)\# router bgp 65300}
\DoxyCodeLine{sonic(config-\/router-\/bgp)\# update-\/delay 120}
\end{DoxyCode}

\hypertarget{md_cli_command-tree_industry_standard_cli_reference_guide_autotoc_md8524}{}\doxysubsubsection{Description}\label{md_cli_command-tree_industry_standard_cli_reference_guide_autotoc_md8524}

\begin{DoxyCode}{0}
\DoxyCodeLine{Erase the existing switch configuration files except the management interface configuration,}
\DoxyCodeLine{or cancel the configuration erase operation.}
\DoxyCodeLine{The "write erase" command deletes the startup configuration JSON file and all application}
\DoxyCodeLine{configuration files in the /etc/sonic directory. The management interface configuration}
\DoxyCodeLine{in the startup configuration file is retained so that the user can access the switch using}
\DoxyCodeLine{the same management address after the switch reboots.}
\DoxyCodeLine{For the write erase command operation to take effect, the user has to reboot the switch}
\DoxyCodeLine{after issuing the write erase command. If the user wishes to not proceed with the configuration}
\DoxyCodeLine{removal operation, the write erase cancel command can be used to undo the previously issued}
\DoxyCodeLine{write erase command.}
\end{DoxyCode}
\hypertarget{md_cli_command-tree_industry_standard_cli_reference_guide_autotoc_md8525}{}\doxysubsubsection{Syntax}\label{md_cli_command-tree_industry_standard_cli_reference_guide_autotoc_md8525}

\DoxyCodeLine{no write erase}
\end{DoxyCode}

\begin{DoxyCode}{0}
\DoxyCodeLine{Use the command "write erase" to erase the existing switch configuration files except for the management interface configuration.}
\DoxyCodeLine{Use the command "no write erase" to cancel configuration erase operation.}
\end{DoxyCode}

\begin{DoxyCode}{0}
\DoxyCodeLine{BGP message Tx I/O is vectored. This means that multiple packets are}
\DoxyCodeLine{written to the peer socket at the same time each I/O cycle, in order to}
\DoxyCodeLine{minimize system call overhead. This value controls how many are written}
\DoxyCodeLine{at a time. Under certain load conditions, reducing this value could make}
\DoxyCodeLine{peer traffic less bursty. In practice, leave this settings on the}
\DoxyCodeLine{default (64).}
\end{DoxyCode}
